intro: Notopleura latistipula, commonly known as the broad-tipped notopleura, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Its flowers are typically small and clustered in inflorescences, producing a distinctive, fragrant aroma. Notopleura latistipula is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or forested areas.
